tool.name: tokamakgen
tool.description: Tool to generate the CAD for a tokamak from a radial build
tool.command: cp '$__tool_directory__/'*py ./ && python generate_geometry.py '$Config' '$TF_coils' '$PF_coils' 2>&1 && mv 'reactor.step' '$reactor_output_file' && mv 'coils.step' '$coil_file' && mv 'radial_build.step' '$reactor_no_coils'

param.name: Config
param.label: Tokamak Config
param.help: Config file for the settings of running geometry generation. Format: JSON

data.name: coil_file
data.label: Coil STEP File
data.help: This is the output file containing the coil geometry format: step.

data.name: reactor_output_file
data.label: Tokamak STEP File
data.help: This is the output file containing the reactor geometry format: step.

data.name: reactor_no_coils
data.label: Tokamak no coils
data.help: This is the output file containing the reactor geometry without the coil geometry format: step.

data.name: TF_coils
data.label: TF Coil Output
data.help: File containing information about the TF coils (i.e position etc) format: csv

data.name: PF_coils
data.label: PF Coil Output
data.help: File containing information about the PF coils (i.e position etc) format: csv

tool.help: This tool run the command writes the file input 'Text_To_Write' to the txt file 'Output_File' in an Ubuntu 20.04 container. This is done via a python script to demonstrate running scripts in Galaxy tools. Expected output: std_out: '' std_err: '' outputs: Output_File: Content of the 'File_To_Write' input
